column4: hi there my friends !! is there any think like visual studio for linux for web develop ??
yes there is, non-free and free. try bluefish for webdevelopment or screem, man apt-cache (search for 'search")
search for editor and grep for tags like HTML
apt-cache search editor | grep html -> proofgeneral-doc !! just this !!
bluefish is in universe do you have the right repository's in your sources.list?
i use visual studio for devoloping web stuf in windows i am trying to find something similar in linux i dont want console stuf !!
yes i can search for it
well there is no console stuff in there.
i already try quanta for it but i think that visual studio its much powerfull !! i would like to find something similar
take a while, experiment with edtiors, try vim and emacs, these are the two most used and advanced editors out there. ( #emacs , #vim )
i understand your point but if the ide its more user friendly then you can program more efficiently and more fast
i usually use vim but only for c programming
